tagline: Real accessibility testing with assistive technology — not just automated scans and checkboxes
pros: Tests with real assistive technology — NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver, TalkBack
Catches the 70% of issues automated tools miss: focus order, ARIA, meaningful content
Provides code examples with every finding — shows exactly how to fix it
Reviews designs before development to catch issues at the cheapest stage
cons: Doesn't implement large-scale fixes — provides guidance for developers to execute
Deep audits take time — can't speed-run a full WCAG AA assessment
Most effective when involved early — retrofitting accessibility is harder

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
